events.title: Pope Innocent VIII Issues Bull Against Witchcraft
events.description: Pope Innocent VIII issues the papal bull 'Summis desiderantes affectibus,' which formally acknowledges the existence of witchcraft and authorizes the Inquisition to prosecute witches.
events.significance: This event marked the intensification of witch hunts in Europe, leading to widespread persecution during the early modern period.

events.title: Battle of Brentford in the English Civil War
events.description: Royalist forces defeat the Parliamentarian garrison at Brentford near London during the First English Civil War.
events.significance: This battle paved the way for the Royalist advance towards London, significantly influencing the early phase of the civil war.

events.title: James Cook Claims Eastern Australia for Britain
events.description: British explorer Captain James Cook claims the eastern coast of Australia for Great Britain, naming it New South Wales.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of British colonization in Australia, profoundly impacting the continent's indigenous populations and history.

events.title: Soviet Invasion of Czechoslovakia Begins
events.description: Warsaw Pact troops, led by the Soviet Union, invade Czechoslovakia to suppress the Prague Spring reform movement.
events.significance: This invasion was a significant event in the Cold War, demonstrating the Soviet Union's control over Eastern Bloc countries and stifling liberal reforms.
